headline: Slow Cooker Oats
description: Start steel-cut oats in the crockpot at night and you'll wake up to a slow cooker bubbling with a hot, hearty mixture of sweet oats, apples, and raisins.

video.description: Perfect use for a slow cooker – delicious and warm oatmeal for the morning!
video.name: Slow Cooker Oats

name: Slow Cooker Oats

recipeInstructions.text: Combine water, steel-cut oats, apple, raisins, butter, brown sugar, cinnamon, and vanilla in a slow cooker; stir until well combined and sugar is dissolved. Cover and cook on Low until oats are tender and creamy, 6 to 7 hours. For a softer texture, cook for 8 hours.

review.reviewBody: Slow cooker oats are always a great way to wake up! This recipe is quite nice and very easy to put together. I used almond milk instead of water and made everything else as written. Nice mellow flavor, very warming.
Great recipe! It is easy to make. I added creamed honey with cinnamon ad I served it.

Perfect breakfast, especially in the winter I add nuts, and raisins, use skim milk instead of water, and add extra. This makes breakfast for a whole week for me. Sometimes I add wheat germ or bran. And extra apples, always extra apples. Yogurt and berries on top make it festive.
Really flavorful. A new fav I will be adding to my rotation. Next time I will either cut down the time in the slow cooker a bit or use a slow cooker bag as the sides and bottom burnt a bit.

I have made a very similar recipe many times. This recipe is very flexible. Use apple juice in place for all or part of the water. Always use unpeeled fruit. I add 3 or 4 apples or pears. Use a heaping tablespoon of cinnamon. Tastes great with lots of fresh berries added while the oatmeal is hot. I make a whole batch of this oatmeal and then refrigerate it. Every morning I take out a bowlful, microwave to heat it up and then top it with plain Greek yogurt and pecans. Delicious.
Followed the recipe (used milk) and my family did not like it. I tried to eat it so it wouldn’t go to waste but I didn’t really enjoy it.
I doubled it, with one cup less water, and cooked it over 4 hours to make it a better texture with the oats I used.

Made this several times already with several variations. Such as: water only, or half milk/half water, all milk... added nuts, sometimes no raisins, sometimes on low and others on the warm setting. I’d say my fave is half/half milk/water, no raisins or nuts, and low setting. The nuts and raisins get too mushy, would rather add at the end. The butter is a MUST in my opinion, makes it super creamy! I love adding a little heavy cream to my personal bowl when serving—yum!
Too much water, too few oats. bitter, tasted horrible, too thick to drink, too thin to plow. Raisins were puffy, apples mushy.

I used this every fall for several years. Here’s some tips. Best thing I discovered was just using a cheese grader and grading the Apple or two into to pot with the skins. Also if you don’t want to use butter I use 2 cups regular coconut milk (more watery type) and 1-1/2 cups water gonna try just 1 cup coconut milk next time but the 2 is really good. I normally cook it for 6 hours with timer over night and get minimal side wall stick. I do 2 apples Fungi (sweetest) and skip the raisins grade apples first before adding anything.
I love how it tasted but it took quite a while to cook

I didn’t have steel cut oats and I was worried that it would be too mushy. I also wanted to turn it on a before bed and wake up to oats that weren’t overcooked. So I used rolled oats, but only set the crock pot on ‘Keep Warm.’ It was very good the next morning. Not too mushy and not sticking or overcooked.
Absolutely horrible! A whole tablespoon of Cinnamon is way too much. All we could taste was this overpowering solid cinnamon.

My fiancee's parents have made overnight oats in their slow cooker and they were really good, so I found this as a way to try to recreate it.
Mine came out great, except it did burn on the bottom/edges. *However* I did notice that there is a note to try it on the warm setting. I'm making it again and will try that, I'm sure it'll work great! I also think I will try increasing the water to 4 cups.
I used dates, walnuts and apples in this - dates are amazing in this recipe!
I made a double batch and followed the recipe. Best oatmeal I've ever had. My wife licked the spoon, and we are sharing half with two toddler grandchildren.

Love this recipe. Oats are nice and tender and the apple with the raisins is so yummy. Sometimes I also add blueberries or bananas and walnuts. This recipe does me for 6 or 7 mornings. By far my favourite way to cook steel cut oats.
Very good. Next time I will decrease the salt, but that was the only change I will make.

Followed the directions as they are and I have to agree that it's quite bland and disappointing. I was super excited to wake up to something really yummy and it just wasn't there for us. I can see it as being a good base recipe to tweak.
This is great. What iI did was put it in a smaller oven safe dish in the crock pot and then there was no clean up and already in a container.
Very good

Loved it! I made it as the recipe stated and then added chopped walnuts on top. I’m going to try apple juice next time. I pretty much fed my kids flourless and eggless cookies for breakfast and was ok with it. Chocolate chips would probably taste good but then it would definitely be a dessert.

When reheating, add milk for a creamier and healthier option. You need to break it up a bit or it has a bread-like texture.

This was my first time trying slow cooker steel oats and it did not turn out as expected. I had it on low for 8 hours and it looked burnt around the edges and way too thick. After looking at other similar recipes, I believe the liquid amount is way off - should have added at least another 1.5 cups. I also cut back on the cinnamon as it just seemed like way too much. I did not add the apples but added twice the raisins. It was edible but just. This recipe really needs doctoring in my opinion.

I made this for Christmas morning breakfast. I was not disappointed with the outcome, but I recommend the minimum cook time to maintain the integrity of the steel cut. Also, the recipe does not call for the addition of salt, and we all know oats are a bit flat without it, so I highly recommend adding it! My husband doesn’t like raisins, so I left them out. The sweetness they would have provided could be compensated with a little additional brown sugar.

Excellent flavor and texture! Super easy breakfast to prepare the night before and have ready for overnight guests who like to get up much earlier than their grandparents. My 7 yo and 9 yo grandsons helped themselves (with supervision) to three large bowls Christmas morning BEFORE opening gifts. 

I lined my crockpot with a bag to save on the mess. I used dried cranberries instead of raisins and half unflavored almond milk and half water. I made a recipe and a half because I wanted to have enough for the four adults, too. I will definitely make this my go-to oatmeal recipe.
Have made it many times, always a hit, step daughter always asking for it when she visits
I made the recipe as is but doubled it. It tastes great, but a lot stuck to the sides of the cooker.
I used half almond milk and half water. Lots of clove, cinnamon and nutmeg. Morning lifesaver
They are always a hit!! I took them to a bible study breakfast and they were eaten up quickly!! My kids love them too!!
AWESOME!!!! I even added dried cranberries along with the raisins and apples. It's amazing and hits the spot every time!

I will make the original recipe again. The second time I made it I was out of apples so I substituted in blackberries. Thank you for the recipe as steel cut oats recipes are difficult to find, especially a good one like this!!
Blueberries on top, with a dollop of whipped cream on top !
Great recipe! I used apricots instead of raisins and I recommend it.
Super yummy! I make a double batch and froze the oatmeal in single serving sized snack bags for a healthy, make-it-ahead, ready-made and easy to pack and go breakfast option.

This is very good. I used milk & some vanilla almond creamer instead of the water. I forgot to spray the inside of the crockpot. Big mistake! It’s hard to clean if you don’t spray it w/ cooking spray. Everyone loved it
Less Cinnamon on the next round.

good on flavor but seemed overcooked. I used the steel cut oats. 7 hours seemed too long. if i try this recipe again, i'll try half the time. it was just a mushy mess. :\

surprised about the star rating...

Good recipe as is. I've been making it for a few weeks. Last night I felt the need for a little more flavor -- so I used Apple Pie spice. Wow! what a pop of flavor!

The apple pie spice recipe in on allrecipes.
I loved it. I have a 6 qt crock pot so I doubled the recipe and used coconut oil instead of butter for a vegan alternative to line the insert only. Cooked for 8hrs, turned out perfect.

I found that this recipe cooked in 6hrs in my old slow cooker without burning or sticking. I only used 1 T. of brown sugar and added stevia to sweeten when I served it. I also added 1/2 c. extra water & 3 T. of flax meal before cooking. The raisins, I added after cooking along with a dollop of yogurt. I can see making this again as it was tasty and easy to make.

Perfect as laid out! I thought no salt would be bland, but it was fine! I used my Instapot on slowcooker setting on "less" for 8 hours and programmed it to start at 11:15pm. It was exactly ready at 7:15am for breakfast! Delicious! One personal tweak- a bit too much cinnamon for me. I think I will half that and add a dash of nutmeg next time.

The first time I tried this recipe, it didn't quite turn out as expected. It was really sticky, and much of the oats stuck to the bottom. Undaunted, I tried again - this time with a few little tweaks - and the second time was the charm! Here's what worked for me: To one cup of STEEL CUT OATS, I added 3.5 cups of water with .5 cup of juice from canned peaches, two cinnamon sticks, some vanilla extract, a dash of salt, and a dribble of maple syrup. I set my crockpot to WARM (not low) for about 6.5 hours. The result was perfect. I added brown sugar, walnuts, milk, and some blueberries to the finished product. YUM!

Fabulous! Next time I will cut in half since it's just for me to take to work. Instead of the raisins, I put dried cranberries. Also, I took this ingredient from another similar recipe: (1) anise star. Really adds a nice kick if you like that flavor. So YUMMY.
Just made this...excellent!! Easy, just put everything in a small crockpot and you're done!
Followed the recipe as is, we love this. Reheats easily for additional breakfast meals.
Super easy & delicious! I substituted the water for milk and it came out perfect. My go to oatmeal recipe! Thanks for sharing!

Used coconut milk rather than water
Omitted sugar

Used the steel cut oats and cooked exactly 8 hours on low with a crockpot liner. It came out BURNT and inedible. The burnt taste was overpowering. I've not noticed my crockpot running too hot for any other recipes. The apples were mush, and the raisins too :( I would recommend trying this on the Warm setting the first time you make it. You can always throw it in a pot in the morning and cook it more, but my batch ended up in the garbage can.

First time to cook steel oats and it came out so delicious. It cooked for 5 hours.I made 2 changes,I used milk, instead of water and decreased the cinnamon to less than half the amount. Came out very good. Will do again.
Way too much cinnamon. If i make this again I will add slightly more sugar and less cinnamon
I would add more water, less sugar and some salt. It also lacks milk, in my opinion. The regular oatmeal I usually cook on a stove tastes much better for me, and it's not time-consuming at all.
Love this recipe! Super easy to make. Next time I’m going to add a few more apples and dried cranberries.
Yes I added 1 1/2 cup of almond milk and 2 cups of water. I also added 1/2 cups of cranberries and apricots.

For liquid, I used half water and half milk..
 This recipe is so creamy and so delicious!

I personally didn't mind it. I had to add a scoop of sugar to have some flavor. Before adding sugar it was kind of bland. My kids did not enjoy it at all, not even with sugar. My fiance took one bite and instantly threw it away. I would definitely add some sugar in it while cooking to create a yummy sweet taste.
I added a bit more cinnamon but other than that it was so delicious. The picture was exactly what I wanted and it turned out great for our Christmas Breakfast amongst other favorites.

I haven't made this yet, but I really want to try it. My question is how long can I actually cook it? We usually don't eat breakfast until around nine. According to the recipe, that would mean I'd have to get up around 1 in the morning to turn on the crock pot. Do any of you have any suggestions?
Cooked for 10 hrs on low heat. Was still very soupie.

Good recipe but instead of steel cut, I recommend using stone ground oats (sometimes called Scottish style) and cut the cooking time in half since ground whole oats are in smaller pieces than steel cut. I did reduce the raisins which I thought would predominate too much. I saw someone post that they normally cook oats in 5 minutes which means they don't usually use steel cut oats. You cannot use 'rolled oats' (which are actually pre-cooked) in this recipe. They will not
Easy and yummy! The kids loved it!
I doubled this recipe, but otherwise didn't change it at all. It is absolutely delicious and easy to make, even for a novice.
After reading all of the reviews I added another apple, ginger, squeezed an orange onto my mixture. It was wonderful. I did spray my crockpot with coconut Pam and unfortunately one end I still stuck.

I finally found an overnight oatmeal recipe in the crock pot that works! I added 1/2 cup of more liquid (3 cups of water and 1 cup of almond milk), I added 2 ripe bananas (mashed), a heaping spoonful of almond butter and 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg and a handful of pecans. I also kept it on warm the whole cooking time (@10 hours) and it didn't scorch, perfect consistency.

Made it as directed and it was very tasty! Its still oatmeal, let's be honest, so don't expect to be singing from the rooftops, but I liked it. I was afraid it would be waaay too cinnamon-y judging by how dark brown it became, but I think it was just right. This was also my first experience with steel-cut oats so I wasn't sure what to expect, but again, very yummy after 5 hours in the slow cooker. Next time I think I will double the apple, but that's just because I love apples. Also grateful for my apple machine that makes peeling, slicing, and coring my apples so easy, so this was a nice fast recipe.
My husband and I both really liked this oatmeal. I didn't change anything, just added another apple
Great taste, texture and outstanding flavor
The taste was good. It was a bit gummy compared to freshly made steel cut oats - but still tasty.
We haven't tried it yet but I subsituded some of the water with Apple cider

This is the 2nd recipe I've tried making steel cut oats in a crock pot. (the first was blueberry banana but we won't go there).This is also the 2nd time I've done this recipe with a few very minor changes.
1)I used a crock pot liner (Reynolds). Worked great, no mess. 
2) I used one granny smith apple. I used one of those corer/slicers that you push down on the apple and slices it into 8 slices. Cut each slice into 4-5 pieces and added them in the pot with the skin on. I figure that they cook for 8 hours, who's going to care that the peel was left on?
3)I used 1 1/2 cups of water and 2 cups of almond milk. I'm not sure why I use almond milk. The recipes I first looked at called for almond milk. I guess it's supposed to be good for you like steel cut oats.
4)I used craisins instead of raisins because raisins will kill my dog.
5)I used 1 Tbsp of apple pie spice instead of cinnamon. The spice also has nutmeg and allspice in it as well as cinnamon. I figured it wouldn't hurt.
I turned this on before bed and had a bowl when I got up in the morning. I left a note telling my wife it was really good and enjoy it but she overslept and only had time to turn the crock pot off before going to work. I tossed the liner and untouched oatmeal in the trash when I came home. That is one reason why I'm making it again. Another reason is it's so gosh darn good!
It was very delicious. I usually like my oatmeal made with milk so it tasted a little watery to me but I’ll just do half and half of water and milk next time! Other than that it’s amazing!

I have been looking for this (or similar) recipe for a long time. This was the only way my Mom could get me to eat oatmeal. Hate the stuff, but baked like this it is more than palatable. We used to call it oatmeal pudding. Thank you!!

I make this a lot. I have made it for a quilting get-together and it was well received. Friends have a bakery area in their farm stand and work all night baking pies at Thanksgiving and I make this for all the workers. All the fixings for this has been sent with my husband to his gaming weekend with 6 guys. They devoured it. It is a nice feeling to wake up and go downstairs to this heavenly smell.
I made this in the crock pot just like recipe said. It was just wonderful. This is a keeper for me!
Added 1/2 cup more water. Excellent recipe...I’m not the hugest fan of oatmeal, so I’m always looking for a recipe with flavor and texture.

This is a very good recipe. For those among us who appreciate a hot breakfast especially on cold winter days, I encourage you to make this recipe. I doubled the recipe using the online adjuster and stored the leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge. Microwaved portions reheat well. I also used this recipe for organic oat groats - simply replacing the steel cut oats with organic oat groats and increasing the water in the recipe by 1/2 cup.

What could be better than coming into your kitchen smelling this wonderful hot breakfast on a very cold morning? I followed the recipe adding a spoonful of organic honey. Delicious! We were happy to have enough for a couple of days just heating it in the microwave oven.

This is an excellent and easy recipe. I only made one change and not sure if that was one or not. It calls for 1 cup chopped apples, so I chopped up one gala and one granny smith, probably more than a cup I did not measure. I have a really plain crockpot, just 2 settings, low and high. I cooked it appx 7 hours on low and it was perfect. Used a crockpot liner, so got every bit. Reheats nicely. My hubby and I are both type 2 diabetics and this did not raise our blood sugar, so bonus for that! Will be making this often! Thanks for the great recipe!
Very good! Made it as written. I did add a little sugar to top at end. Very tasty. I had never tasted steel cut oats and they were delicious.

I’ve gotta say this... I was absolutely hating having to make this. Why? Because the last time I had oats I was 5 (44 years ago lol) and I swore to my mom that I’d go hungry before I ever choked them down again. 
Fast forward and a new diet with meal prepping has taken place and I’m amazed how delicious this is! I used 2.5 cups unsweetened almond milk and 1.5 cups of water, did not add raisins, used light brown sugar, and everything else the recipe calls for. I sprayed the crock pot with Pam and cooked on low for a little over 5 hours (cooked during the day so I could keep track of it). My serving size turned out to be about 3/4 cup and there were 6 servings. I sprinkled 1tsp of chia seeds over each serving before refrigerating. I’m sure I’ll add a bit of almond milk when I reheat the oats but the sweetness, cinnamon and apple flavors were all perfect! Adding up what I used, each serving including chia seeds is 147 calories. Nutritious, tasty breakfast
Excellent!!!!

First Attempts In Learning! I added about one-half cup more apple and I think that added too much extra liquid. It cooked on low for 7 hours, but that wasn’t enough to thicken the oatmeal as shown in the recipe photo. The color was dark brown, which surprised me. However, The flavor was very tasty good. I will try again with adjustments following the exact recipe.
No changes. Yes, I will make it again.

I made this overnight in my rice cooker set to warm. I used one cup steel cut oats, two cups almond milk, two snack boxes of craisins, two snack containers of cinnamon applesauce, and a tablespoon of stevia. It cooked perfectly. (Note: one cup = the cup that comes with the rice cooker)

I wanted to try a healthy option for breakfast that wouldn't cause a problem. I also only wanted to use my little crock, rather than my 5 or 6 quart pot. (Yeah I have multiple crock pots)

Oye.

First, how do you know if your slow cooker cooks hot? Well make this..because if it turns into a boiling..yes burned mess...well it cooks hot. (I also have 5 burned fingers from this fiasco) I now feel like a candidate for worst cooks in America. Anne Burrell is going to be knocking on my door.

So my advice, if you make this.. Make sure you have a crock with a warm setting.

The end result that wasn't stuck to my crock was good, but on top of it all runny. I would say it might need more oats than directed, because a 6-7 hour cook time should have produced firm oats and mine was full of cinnamon soup.

The taste was very good though, but I think I'll be hesitant to do oatmeal in a slow cooker again

I made this recipe with equal parts liquid to steel cut oats and it definitely should be a 3:1 ratio, as it was dry. But it's nothing you can't fix by either adding liquid to the crockpot or adding milk to your bowl. The spices were a hit.

This was fantastic! I did 2 c. almond milk and 1.5 c. water, plus 1 tbsp ground flax. Used a Gala apple (bc that's what we had on hand) and the maple syrup instead of brown sugar; normally I like to dump the brown sugar on after it's cooked, along with some milk, but I found it sweet enough that it didn't need any extra sugar at all! Hooray!
The amount of cinnamon was fantastic as well. 
Because I'd made slow cooker oatmeal before and found it to burn on the edges, this time, I tried 2 hours on Low, then turned it to Warm while we slept. It was a little crusty on the edges when we woke up, but not burnt. 

And hey, I found a trick on the internet for help with the burnt-on, caked-on remainder, and it works like a charm!

"The Crock-Pot Ladies recommend sprinkling baking soda onto stuck-on food before scrubbing. If that doesn't work, their second course of action is to pour 1/4 cup of baking soda into the ceramic pot, fill it with water, and add a dash of dish soap. Then cover it and set on high for 2-4 hours."

Used 4 cups of water, and it was a good consistency, maybe even a little thicker than we'd typically like. Put on "keep warm" in my crockpot for around 8 hours. Kids loved this, need to double sugar at least. Served with some sprinkled on top, a little cream/milk, and pecans.
Was very bland and tasted like perfume. I added some brown sugar to add some taste and still mediocre at best.
I will make it again. I switched out raisins for dates then cut out the brown sugar due to sweetness of the dates.

This recipe was a big hit for our group, which included children who were very picky eaters. I doubled the recipe which still fit nicely into my standard Crock Pot. A big Granny Smith Apple gave the oatmeal a nice flavor without being sweet. Next time I will try a Golden Delicious to see how a sweeter apple works. Highly recommend this recipe!
it's a little bland and the amount of cinnamon dries your mouth
I substituted 1/2 the water for apple juice. Oatmeal came out perfectly cooked on low for 7 hrs.
This was a gloppy mess. I did not like it at all. Ended up in the garbage and that is so sad cause I love oatmeal.
easy to prepare and delicious. I grated the apple instead of slicing and also added honey - came out awesome
Yum!

Made this last night and OH WOW is all I can say! It is wonderfully filling and so delicious! I added a T spoon of butter to my three large scoops, a T sugar and about 1/4 c milk. My husband loved it and wants me to make more and refrigerate to have bowls on demand. One thing I did was add 1/2 c more Brown Sugar and a T vanilla instead of a t spoon. I also used Granny smith apples.
This was a simple recipe, and it was amazing to wake up to a hot breakfast, although I found it didn't have enough apple flavor for my liking. Still good eats. Thanx.
Followed the recipe exactly and the results are awesome. Will definitely make again and start using different add ins.

Delicious! Made using milk rather than water (personal preference). I did not add raisins or cranberries, but did use two small Gala apples (w/o skin). Needed a little salt. Will definitely make again.
I followed the recipe exactly and I will definitely make this again! It turned out great! First time I ever had steel cut oats! They are very good!
